duties_responsibilities.duty: Lead and train the team to support programmatic initiatives, goals, and daily routines for individuals with disabilities.
Manage staff schedules, ensure shifts are adequately staffed, and provide training on daily routines including cleaning, cooking, and medication administration.
Manage team performance through effective communication, training, performance management, and employee recognition.
Develop and implement activity programs including the Meaningful Day curriculum and update Individual Support Plans with the interdisciplinary team.
Ensure individuals are supported per their Individual Support Plans including medication management, meal planning, and behavior management.
Ensure program documentation and billable records are completed accurately and timely, and assist with monitoring the finances of individuals.
Monitor the health and medical needs of individuals and manage relationships with their families and guardians.
Ensure work locations and vehicles are clean, well-maintained, and stocked with necessary supplies.
May be required to fill shifts when staffing issues arise and cooperate with inspection, inquiry, or investigation by department staff.
Additional tasks and responsibilities may be assigned.
